meanings.definition: An instance of invading a country or region with an armed force.
meanings.sent1: The invasion of the enemy troops was swift and unexpected.
meanings.sent2: The history books are filled with stories of invasion and conquest.
meanings.sent3: The ants' invasion of the picnic caused chaos among the guests.
meanings.sent4: The invasion of technology into our daily lives has changed how we communicate.
meanings.sent5: The invasion of colorful balloons at the party delighted the children.

meanings.definition: An incursion by a large number of people or things into a place.
meanings.sent1: The invasion of tourists during the holiday season crowded the streets.
meanings.sent2: The invasion of new ideas into the classroom sparked creativity among students.
meanings.sent3: The invasion of cookies into the jar mysteriously happened overnight.
meanings.sent4: The invasion of laughter filled the room during the comedy show.
meanings.sent5: The invasion of butterflies in the garden painted a beautiful scene.
